sense.name: dive, dunk or rapid swim through water
sense.examples: We decided to take a plunge in the cool mountain lake. Jane took the cold plunge after the Roman bath at the spa. A plunge in the pool each morning before breakfast always clears my mind.

sense.name: a sharp or rapid descent
sense.commentary: PLUNGE[+action][+descent][+rapid] Note: usually implies a quantitative change
sense.examples: The stock market experienced a 30 percent plunge on black Monday. The aircraft made a plunge when it hit a strong downdraft at 30,000 feet. The country was devastated by the plunge in its currency in the world markets. John was baffled by his sudden plunge into depression. (figurative)
